TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ActivityDesignerTheme extends System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerTheme

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Provides the look and feel property settings to a designer in a design-time environment.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
Designer themes define the look and feel of a designer. This includes any background styles, foreground styles, fonts, and icons defined for the designer.
You can create a custom designer theme if you want to provide configuration abilities to properties unique to your designer. If you do not specify a designer theme for a custom designer, the theme from the base class is used.
## Examples The following example shows how to create a custom <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme> by deriving from the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme> class and setting the appropriate properties for the new theme.
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#80](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets.cs#80)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#80](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets.vb#80)]
To use the theme on an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner>, apply the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerThemeAttribute> to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> class.
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#79](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets.cs#79)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#79](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets.vb#79)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the to end with when using a color gradient for the background color.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme.BackColorEnd%2A> indicates the ending color of a background gradient. To use background gradient color, set the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme.BackColorStart%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme.BackColorEnd%2A> properties. The background will gradually change color from the starting color to the ending color.
## Examples The following example shows how to create a custom <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme> by deriving from the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme> class and setting the appropriate properties for the new theme.
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#80](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets.cs#80)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#80](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets.vb#80)]
To use the theme on an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner>, apply the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerThemeAttribute> to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> class.
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#79](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets.cs#79)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#79](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets.vb#79)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the starting color of the background when using a color gradient on the background.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme.BackColorStart%2A> indicates the background color, or the beginning color of a background gradient. To use background gradient color, set the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme.BackColorStart%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme.BackColorEnd%2A> properties. The background will gradually change color from the start color to the end color.
## Examples The following example shows how to create a custom <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme> by deriving from the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme> class and setting the appropriate properties for the new theme.
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#80](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets.cs#80)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#80](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets.vb#80)]
To use the theme on an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner>, apply the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerThemeAttribute> to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> class.
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#79](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets.cs#79)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#79](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets.vb#79)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property BackgroundStyle As LinearGradientMode

public: virtual property System::Drawing::Drawing2D::LinearGradientMode BackgroundStyle { System::Drawing::Drawing2D::LinearGradientMode get(); void set(System::Drawing::Drawing2D::LinearGradientMode value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the background style.
Docs.value: A that describes the background style.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme.BackgroundStyle%2A> to get or set how the background displays color. The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme.BackgroundStyle%2A> can be set to one of four modes:
`BackwardDiagonal` Specifies a gradient from upper right to lower left.
`ForwardDiagonal` Specifies a gradient from upper left to lower right.
`Horizontal` Specifies a gradient from left to right.
`Vertical` Specifies a gradient from top to bottom.
## Examples The following example shows how to create a custom <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme> by deriving from the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme> class and setting the appropriate properties for the new theme.
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#80](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets.cs#80)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#80](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets.vb#80)]
To use the theme on an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner>, apply the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerThemeAttribute> to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> class.
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#79](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets.cs#79)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#79](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets.vb#79)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DesignerGeometry As DesignerGeometry

Docs.summary: Gets the geometry of the designer.
Docs.value: An enumeration that describes the geometry of the designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme.DesignerGeometry%2A> represents the default geometry of shapes for the theme.
`Rectangle` Draws shapes with squared corners.
`RoundedRectangle` Draws shapes with rounded corners.

Docs.summary: Gets the object associated with the theme.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Assigning this property causes the brush associated with the theme to draw filled lines and curves.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ForegroundPen As Pen
public: property System::Drawing::Pen ^ ForegroundPen { System::Drawing::Pen ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the used for painting the foreground of the theme.
Docs.value: A that is used to paint the foreground of the theme.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Drawing.Pen> is used to draw a line of a specified width and style. The line drawn by a `Pen` object can be filled in a variety of fill styles, including solid colors and textures. The fill style depends on which brush or texture used as the fill object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Drawing.Brush GetBackgroundBrush(valuetype System.Drawing.Rectangle rectangle) cil managed

Docs.param: A that specifies the location and size of the area on the background.
Docs.summary: Gets a brush used to paint the area specified by the rectangle passed.
Docs.returns: A that is used to fill interiors of graphical shapes such as rectangles, ellipses, pies, polygons, and paths.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The background brush is used to fill the interior of the background of the designer.
